steps.description: Customer clicks from a comparison site (e.g., comparison sites) to the providerâ€™s SIM-only landing page.
steps.businessRationale: Click-through attribution is critical for paid affiliate channels; delays reduce tracking accuracy and partner payouts.

steps.description: Customer reviews SIM-only plans, compares data allowances, and selects a monthly contract.
steps.businessRationale: Plan comparison involves pricing APIs and eligibility checks; longer durations increase drop-off risk.

steps.description: Customer enters personal details and the provider performs identity and fraud checks.
steps.businessRationale: Identity checks are mandatory for mobile contracts; delays or failures directly block revenue.

steps.description: Customer enters payment details and completes the SIM-only purchase.
steps.businessRationale: Payment processing is the highest-value step; latency or errors cause immediate revenue loss.

steps.description: Customer receives SIM, inserts it, and the provider activates the mobile service.
steps.businessRationale: Activation latency impacts first-day experience and early churn; provisioning APIs must be reliable.

steps.description: Customer uses mobile data for the first time; the provider tracks network performance and early satisfaction indicators.
steps.businessRationale: First-day data experience strongly predicts long-term retention; poor performance increases churn risk.
